name: invalidate

to officially stop a document, ticket, law, etc. being legally or officially acceptable
to prove that an opinion, argument, etc. is wrong

Add to word list
Add to word list
to make something not true, or to make something unacceptable: A few minor factual errors should not invalidate the theory.
Add to word list
Add to word list
to officially stop a document, contract, etc. being legally or officially acceptable: If you do not go to an approved garage, you are likely to invalidate a warranty on a new car. Compare
validate invalidation noun [ U ]
The error led to the invalidation of American scores on an international test.
